text: Arnica louiseana is a Canadian species of arnica in the sunflower family, known by the common name Lake Louise arnica or snow arnica.Flora of North America, Lake Louise arnica, snow arnica, Arnica louiseanaBiota of North America Program 2014 state-level distribution map It is native to the Canadian Rockies in Alberta and British Columbia, and named for Lake Louise in Banff National Park. Arnica louiseana is a small plant rarely more than 20 cm (8 inches) tall. Flower heads are yellow, with both ray florets and disc florets. It grows at high elevations in alpine tundra and rocky outcrops.Farr, Edith May 1906.
